alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:18PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Blackstone River At Northbridge affecting Worcester County. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. Charles River At Dover affecting Middlesex and Norfolk Counties. Neponset River At Norwood affecting Norfolk and Suffolk Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Taunton River Near Bridgewater affecting Bristol and Plymouth Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blackstone River...including Northbridge, Woonsocket... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Neponset River...including Norwood...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Taunton River...including Bridgewater...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawtuxet River at Cranston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, This is a serious and potentially life threatening flood situation. Follow the directions of local officials if you are asked to evacuate. Do not go sightseeing and stay away from river banks, which can suddenly give way due to erosion and fast moving water. Swiftly moving water can pose an imminent threat to life. Evacuations are likely in Warwick, West Warwick and Cranston. Homes and businesses will be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EST Wednesday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.7 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 03/15/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
